analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati  ārammaṇa paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ
translated: As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …

original: …pe… dve khandhe paccayā dve khandhā, vatthuṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: pe dve khandhe paccayā dve khandhāḥ vatthum paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu āyatana
translated: As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …🔽As condition, a resultant mind-consciousness element arises …

original: paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, sotāyatanaṁ paccayā sotaviññāṇaṁ, ghānāyatanaṁ paccayā ghānaviññāṇaṁ,🔽jivhāyatanaṁ paccayā jivhāviññāṇaṁ, kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ; vatthuṁ paccayā
analyzed: paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sota āyatanam paccayā sota viññāṇa ghāna āyatanam paccayā ghāna viññāṇa  jivhā āyatanam paccayā jivhā viññāṇa kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā
translated: Dependent on the eye and forms, eye-consciousness arises. Dependent on the ear and sounds, ear-consciousness arises. Dependent on the nose and smells, nose-consciousness arises.

original: vipākā khandhā, paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paccayā vipākā khandhā.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: vipākā khandhā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paccayā vipākā khandhā  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā vatthum paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: Dependent on the tongue and tastes, tongue-consciousness arises. Dependent on the body and touches, body-consciousness arises. Dependent on the mind and thoughts, mind-consciousness arises. Dependent on the physical basis,🔽the resultant aggregates arise. At the time of rebirth-linking, dependent on the physical basis, the resultant aggregates arise.

original: Vipākañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati🔽ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā tayo
analyzed: vipākam ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati  ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatam ekam khandhañca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā tayo
translated: A resultant phenomenon and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant phenomenon are conditionally related to a resultant phenomenon as object condition. Dependent on the physical basis, the resultant phenomena arise.🔽A resultant phenomenon and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant phenomenon are conditionally related to a resultant phenomenon as object condition.

original: khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā dve khandhā, sota … ghāna … jivhā
analyzed: khandhā pe dve khandhe ca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā dve khandhā sota ghāna jivhā
translated: Dependent on one of the aggregates that is associated with eye-consciousness and the eye faculty, three aggregates arise … Dependent on two of the aggregates that are associated with eye-consciousness and the eye faculty, two aggregates arise. Dependent on the ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties,

original: … kāya … vipākaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe🔽ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca
analyzed: kāya vipākam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe  ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipākam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca
translated: … the body … as a result of one of the aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … the two aggregates.

original: paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā.🔽Vipākadhammadhammañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo🔽uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—vipākadhammadhammaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo
analyzed: paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā  vipāka dhamma dhammam ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammo  uppajjati ārammaṇa paccaya avipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo
translated: … as a result of one of the aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … the two aggregates.

original: khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā.
analyzed: khandhā pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā
translated: As a result of a resultant and a non-resultant-by-nature phenomenon there arises a resultant phenomenon, as object condition. As a result of one of the aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … the two aggregates.

original: Adhipati🔽Vipākaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—vipākaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā … tīṇi. (Adhipatiyā paṭisandhikkhaṇe natthi.)
analyzed: adhipati  vipākam dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati adhipati paccayā vipākam ekam khandham paccayā tīṇi adhipatiyā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe natthi
translated: Predominance🔽As a result of a resultant phenomenon there arises a resultant phenomenon, as predominance condition. As a result of one of the aggregates … (as in §10). (At the moment of rebirth-linking there is none.)

original: Vipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā tīṇi
translated: As a result of a resultant-by-nature phenomenon there arises a resultant phenomenon … (as in §10).

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-resultant-by-non-causality as condition, a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-resultant-by-non-causality arise.

original: adhipatipaccayā—nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā🔽cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe paccayā dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: adhipati paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ  citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpam pe dve khandhe paccayā dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca
translated: Conditioned by a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-resultant-by-non-causality, the three non-resultant-by-contact and non-resultant-by-non-causality mental aggregates arise.🔽Conditioned by two non-resultant-by-contact and non-resultant-by-non-causality mental aggregates, the other non-resultant-by-contact and non-resultant-by-non-causality mental aggregates and the form that is derived from the four great elements arise.

original: rūpaṁ, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paccayā tayo mahābhūtā …pe… mahābhūte paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ🔽rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: rūpe ekam mahābhūtam paccayā tayaḥ mahābhūtā pe mahābhūte paccayā citta samuṭṭhāna  rūpam vatthum paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: Conditioned by one of the great essentials, the other three great essentials arise.🔽Conditioned by the great essentials, the form that is derived from the great essentials and the form that is not derived from the great essentials arise.🔽Conditioned by the physical basis, the non-resultant-by-contact and non-resultant-by-non-causality mental aggregates arise.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vipākā khandhā.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā vipākā khandhāḥ
translated: With a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-resultant-by-non-causality as condition, a resultant consciousness arises.🔽Conditioned by the physical basis, the resultant mental aggregates arise.🔽With a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-resultant-by-non-causality as condition, a resultant-by-contact and a resultant-by-non-causality arise.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: Conditioned by the physical basis, the resultant-by-contact and resultant-by-non-causality mental aggregates arise.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipāko ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: A resultant and a non-resultant-by-way-of-action state is conditionally related to a resultant and a non-resultant-by-way-of-action state.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti adhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vipākā khandhā, mahābhūte paccayā🔽cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā vipākā khandhā mahābhūte paccayā  citta samuṭṭhānam  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammo ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: With a non-resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature state as condition, resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature states arise by predominance condition. …🔽With the physical basis as condition, the resultant aggregates. translated: With one resultant aggregate and the physical basis as condition, three aggregates. … With two aggregates and the physical basis as condition, two aggregates.

original: Vipākañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—vipāke khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.🔽Vipākañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti adhipatipaccayā—vipākaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo

translated: With an effect and a non-causally-matured-non-causally-matured-state phenomenon as condition, a non-causally-matured-non-causally-matured-state phenomenon arises by way of predominance condition – with the effect-khandhas and the great primaries as condition, the form that is derived from the khandhas.

translated: A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.

original: āsevanapaccayā—nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā …pe… vatthuṁ
analyzed: āsevana paccaya anevavipākana vipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandham paccayā pe vatthu
translated: A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.

original: paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati āsevanapaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammā khandhā.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati āsevana paccayā vatthum paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: A resultant materiality is related to a resultant consciousness element and its concomitants as repetition condition.🔽A

original: Vipākadhammadhammañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo🔽uppajjati āsevanapaccayā—vipākadhammadhammaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo🔽khandhā, tayo khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā eko khandho, dve khandhe ca vatthuñca
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammam ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammo  uppajjati āsevana paccaya avipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo  khandhā tayo khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe ca vatthuñca
translated: With a resultant-law-of-nature idea and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-law-of-nature idea as conditions, a resultant-law-of-nature idea …

original: paccayā dve khandhā.
analyzed: paccayā dve khandhā
translated: With one of the aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates; with the three aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the one aggregate; with two of the aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the two aggregates.

original: Kamma
analyzed: kamma
translated: Kamma Condition

original: Vipākaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati kammapaccayā … tīṇi. (Sahajātasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: vipākam dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati kamma paccayā tīṇi sahajāta sadisa
translated: With a resultant idea as condition, a resultant idea is successively caused to arise through the kamma condition … there are three. (As in the section on conascence.)

original: Vipāka
analyzed: vipāka
translated: Resultant Condition

original: Vipākaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati vipākapaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati🔽vipākapaccayā—ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paccayā tayo mahābhūtā …pe… dve mahābhūte paccayā dve
analyzed: vipākam dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati vipāka paccayā tīṇi  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati  vipāka paccayā ekam mahābhūtam paccayā tayaḥ mahābhūtā pe dve mahābhūte paccayā dve
translated: With a resultant idea as condition, a resultant idea is successively caused to arise through the resultant condition … there are three.🔽Neither-Resultant-Nor-Resultant-Law-of-Nature Condition

original: mahābhūtā, mahābhūte paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ …pe…
analyzed: mahābhūtāḥ mahābhūte paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpam pe
translated: With a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-law-of-nature idea as condition, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-law-of-nature idea is successively caused to arise through the resultant condition: with one great primary as condition, the three great primaries … with two great primaries as condition, the two great primaries. With the great primaries as condition, the form that is derived from the great primaries, bodily intimation, verbal intimation, the bodily and verbal formations. …

original: vipāko ca ubhayañca … tīṇi.
analyzed: vipākaḥ ca ubhayañca tīṇi
translated: Resultant and related … three.

original: Vipākañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca … tīṇi.
analyzed: vipākam ca na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca tīṇi
translated: Resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature … three.

original: Āhārādi
analyzed: āhāra ādi
translated: With respect to nutriment, etc.

original: Āhārapaccayā … indriyapaccayā … jhānapaccayā … maggapaccayā … sampayuttapaccayā … vippayuttapaccayā … atthipaccayā … natthipaccayā … vigatapaccayā … avigatapaccayā.
analyzed: āhāra paccayā indriya paccayā jhāna paccayā magga paccayā sampayutta paccayā vippayutta paccayā atthi paccayā natthi paccayā vigata paccayā avigata paccayā
translated: With respect to nutriment … With respect to faculty … With respect to jhāna … With respect to path … With respect to association … With respect to dissociation … With respect to presence … With respect to absence … With respect to disappearance … With respect to non-disappearance.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration.

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure🔽Seventeen with respect to cause, seven with respect to object, seventeen with respect to predominance, seven with respect to proximity,

original: Hetuyā sattarasa, ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā sattarasa, anantare satta, samanantare🔽satta, sahajāte sattarasa, aññamaññe nava, nissaye sattarasa, upanissaye satta, purejāte🔽satta, āsevane cattāri, kamme sattarasa, vipāke nava, āhāre sattarasa, indriye sattarasa,🔽jhāne sattarasa, magge sattarasa, sampayutte satta, vippayutte sattarasa, atthiyā
analyzed: hetuyā sattarasa ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā sattarasa anantare satta samanantare  satta sahajāte sattarasa aññamaññe nava nissaye sattarasa upanissaye satta purejāte  satta āsevane cattāri kamme sattarasa vipāke nava āhāre sattarasa indriye sattarasa  jhāne sattarasa magge sattarasa sampayutte satta vippayutte sattarasa atthiyā
translated: seven with respect to contiguity,

original: sattarasa, natthiyā satta, vigate satta, avigate sattarasa.
analyzed: sattarasa natthiyā satta vigate satta avigate sattarasa
translated: seven with respect to presence, nine with respect to presence and absence, seventeen with respect to presence and disappearance, seventeen with respect to presence and non-disappearance, seventeen with respect to absence and disappearance, seventeen with respect to absence and non-disappearance, seventeen with respect to disappearance and non-disappearance, seventeen with respect to presence and absence and disappearance, seventeen with respect to presence and absence and non-disappearance, seventeen with respect to presence and disappearance and non-disappearance, seventeen with respect to presence and absence and disappearance and non-disappearance.

original: Hetuduka
analyzed: hetu duka
translated: The section on cause.

original: Hetupaccayā ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā sattarasa …pe… avigate sattarasa.
analyzed: hetu paccayā ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā sattarasa pe avigate sattarasa
translated: With cause as condition, seven [types of] object. With predominance, seventeen … With non-hindrance, seventeen.

original: Yathā kusalattike gaṇanā, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike gaṇanā evam
translated: The calculation should be done as in the case of the wholesome triad.

original: Anulomaṁ.🔽1.4.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: anuloma  paccaya paccanīya
translated: In succession.🔽… With conditions as their opposites.

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on analysis

original: Nahetu🔽Vipākaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ vipākaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā … tīṇi.🔽Vipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: na hetu  vipākam dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam vipākam ekam khandham paccayā tīṇi  vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With no cause🔽With a resultant as condition, a resultant dhammas arise, with no cause as condition: with one wholesome aggregate as condition … with three.🔽With a resultant-originated dhammas as condition, resultant-originated dhammas arise, with no cause as condition: with the aggregates that are associated with doubt and with agitation as condition, the perversion of view and the perversion of doubt that are associated with doubt and with agitation.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā …pe….
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ekam khandham paccayā pe
translated: With a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-originated dhammas as condition, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-originated dhammas arises, with no cause as condition: with a single rootless neither-resultant-nor-resultant-originated aggregate as condition …

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe….🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā cakkhā āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vatthum paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With a non-resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature state as condition, a resultant-by-nature state arises that is related to it by way of non-restraint condition, but not by way of root condition.🔽With a non-resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature state as condition, a resultant state and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state arise that are related to it by way of non-restraint condition, but not by way of root condition.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā vipāko ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā vipākā khandhā, mahābhūte🔽paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…🔽Vipākañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipāko dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo  ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā vatthum paccayā ahetukāḥ vipākāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte  paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  vipākam ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca dhammam paccayā vipākaḥ dhammo uppajjati

analyzed: pe neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati pe vipākaḥ ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: … With a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state as condition, a resultant state and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state arise that are related to it by way of non-restraint condition, but not by way of root condition.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā …pe… tīṇi.
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā pe tīṇi
translated: and three from non-causally arisen mind elements.🔽From a resultant and a neither-result-nor-resultant mind element, a resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …

original: Vipākadhammadhammañca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo🔽uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammam ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam ca dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammo  uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca
translated: From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …

analyzed: paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho  na ārammaṇa
translated: From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …🔽From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …

original: Vipākaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Saṅkhyāvāra🔽Suddha🔽Nahetuyā dvādasa, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: vipākam dhammam paccayā na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  saṅkhyāvāra  suddha  na hetuyā dvādasa na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element arises …

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte dvādasa, napacchājāte sattarasa,🔽naāsevane sattarasa, nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte dvādasa na pacchājāte sattarasa 🔽na āsevane sattarasa na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: From a resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element, a neither-resultant-nor-resultant mind element

original: najhāne cattāri, namagge nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na jhāne cattāri na magge nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: there are four in the non-cognizant, nine in the path, five in the unassociated, three in the not-dissociated,🔽

original: pañca, novigate pañca.🔽1.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: pañca na u vigate pañca  paccaya paccanīya
translated: in non-resolve, four; in non-path, nine; in non-concomitance, five; in non-deprivation, five.🔽.. In the section on conditions in reverse order

original: Vibhaṅgavāra🔽Nahetuduka
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra  na hetu duka
translated: The Division on Analysis🔽The Section on the Triad Beginning with “Not Root-Cause”

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā dvādasa, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā dvādasa na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: With “not root-cause” as condition, there are three in “not object,” twelve in “not predominance,” three in “not proximity,” three in “not contiguity,” …

original: tīṇi …pe… nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke cattāri, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne cattāri,
analyzed: tīṇi pe na kamme eka na vipāke cattāri na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne cattāri
translated: … one in “not kamma,” four in “not kamma-result,” one in “not nutriment,” one in “not faculty,” four in “not jhāna,”

original: namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: nine in “not path,” three in “not-concomitance,” two in “not-deprivation,” three in “not-decisive-support,” three in “not-detriment,” three in “not-uplifting,” three in “not- cleansing,” and three in “not-object-of-consciousness.”

original: (Yathā kusalattike paccanīyagaṇanā, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike paccanīya gaṇanā evam
translated: (The reckoning in reverse order should be done as in the case of the triad of the profitable, that is, “With not-root-cause as condition there are three states that are not object” and so on.)

original: Paccanīyaṁ.🔽1.4.3.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccanīya  paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: In reverse order.🔽.. In the section on conditions in reverse order and in forward order

original: Hetuduka
analyzed: hetu duka
translated: The Section on the Triad Beginning with “Root-Cause”

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa …pe… novigate pañca.
analyzed: hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa pe no vigate pañca
translated: With “root-cause” as condition, there are five in “not object,” seventeen in “not predominance,” … and five in “not-object-of-consciousness.”

original: (Yathā kusalattike anulomapaccanīyagaṇanā, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala ttike anuloma paccanīya gaṇanā evam
translated: (The reckoning in forward order and in reverse order should be done as in the case of the triad of the profitable.)

original: Anulomapaccanīyaṁ.🔽1.4.3.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: anuloma paccanīya  paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: In forward order and in reverse order.🔽.. In the section on conditions in forward order and in reverse order

original: Nahetuduka
analyzed: na hetu duka
translated: The Section on the Triad Beginning with “Not Root-Cause”

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe satta, anantare satta, samanantare satta, sahajāte dvādasa,🔽aññamaññe nava, nissaye dvādasa, upanissaye satta, purejāte satta, āsevane cattāri,🔽kamme dvādasa, vipāke nava, āhāre dvādasa, indriye dvādasa, jhāne dvādasa, magge🔽tīṇi, sampayutte satta, vippayutte dvādasa, atthiyā dvādasa, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe satta anantare satta samanantare satta sahajāte dvādasa  aññamaññe nava nissaye dvādasa upanissaye satta purejāte satta āsevane cattāri  kamme dvādasa vipāke nava āhāre dvādasa indriye dvādasa jhāne dvādasa magge  tīṇi sampayutte satta vippayutte dvādasa atthiyā dvādasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: With non-root condition … as object seven … With non-preceeding condition … seven … With non-immediate condition … seven … With non-contiguous condition … seven … With co-nascence seven … With support seven … With object seven … With distance seven … With dissociation seven … With presence seven … With absence seven … With disappearance seven … With non-disappearance seven.

original: satta, avigate dvādasa.🔽Tika🔽Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe dve …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽(Yathā kusalattike paccanīyānulomagaṇanā, evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)

translated: a view arises, doubt arises, agitation arises, sorrow arises. When a profitable or a functional consciousness has ceased, its result, the object of which is that (consciousness), arises.

original: Vipāko dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—sekkhā phalaṁ paccavekkhanti,🔽vipāke khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti; taṁ🔽ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati, cetopariyañāṇena vipākacittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: vipākaḥ dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya usekkhā phalam paccavekkhanti  vipāke khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti  ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena vipāka citta samaṅgissa
translated: A resultant consciousness is related to a resultant consciousness as object condition: a trainer, having resolved on the knowledge of the destruction (of the fetters), recollects his knowledge of the destruction (of the fetters).

original: cittaṁ jānanti. Vipākā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa
analyzed: cittam jānanti vipākā khandhā cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa
translated: He contemplates as painful, as not self, as subject to destruction, as subject to vanishing, as subject to cessation, as subject to fading away. He relishes it, desires it, and finds satisfaction in it. Because of this, greed arises … sorrow arises. The knowledge of the mind-made body is related to a resultant consciousness as object condition. The knowledge of the recollection of past lives, the knowledge of the passing away and arising (of beings),

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: are related to resultant aggregates as object condition.

original: Vipāko dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— arahā
analyzed: vipākaḥ dhammaḥ na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ arahā
translated: A resultant consciousness is related to a neither-resultant-nor-functional consciousness as object condition: a perfected being,

original: phalaṁ paccavekkhati, vipāke khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati, cetopariyañāṇena
analyzed: phalam paccavekkhati vipāke khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena
translated: he reflects on the result, he comprehends the resultant aggregates as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, as an abscess, as a barb, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as empty, as non-self.🔽The mind of one possessing resultant consciousness is known by the knowledge of penetration of minds.

original: vipākacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti. Vipākā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: vipāka citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti vipākā khandhā cetaḥ pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: Resultant aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of penetration of minds, for knowledge of past lives,

original: anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Vipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ
analyzed: anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayodānam da tvā sīla
translated: for knowledge of the future, and for adverting.

original: samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati,🔽jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ paccavekkhati, sekkhā gotrabhuṁ paccavekkhanti, vodānaṁ🔽paccavekkhanti, sekkhā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti, sekkhā pahīne kilese
analyzed: samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati  jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam paccavekkhati sekkhāḥ gotrabhum paccavekkhanti vodāna  paccavekkhanti sekkhāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti sekkhāḥ pahīne kilese
translated: A resultant idea is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant idea: having given a gift, having undertaken moral discipline, having performed the duties of the Uposatha, he reflects on that; he reflects on what was well done in the past;🔽having emerged from jhāna, he reflects on the jhāna; the trainers reflect on the change-of-lineage; they reflect on the cleansing;

original: paccavekkhanti, vikkhambhite kilese paccavekkhanti, pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānanti,
analyzed: paccavekkhanti vikkhambhite kilese paccavekkhanti pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānanti
translated: having emerged from the path, they reflect on the path; the trainers reflect on the defilements that have been abandoned; they reflect on the defilements that have been suppressed; they know the defilements that were formerly indulged in;

original: vipākadhammadhamme khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti;
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhamme khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti
translated: When they reflect on the aggregates subject to change as being impermanent, painful, and not-self, and they enjoy it, and find satisfaction and delight in it,

original: taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati, cetopariyañāṇena vipākadhammadhammacittasamaṅgissa🔽cittaṁ jānanti. Ākāsānañcāyatanakusalaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanakusalassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena vipāka dhamma dhamma citta samaṅgissa  cittam jānanti ākāsānañcāyatana kusalam viññāṇañcāyatana kusalassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: then greed arises in them. … and grief arises in them. When they know the cognizance of another person who is subject to change as being subject to change,🔽then the profitable cognizance of the base consisting of boundless space is a condition, as object condition,🔽for the profitable cognizance of the base consisting of boundless consciousness. The profitable cognizance of the base consisting of nothingness is a condition, as object condition,

original: paccayo. Ākiñcaññāyatanakusalaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakusalassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ ākiñcañña āyatana kusalam nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kusalassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: for the profitable cognizance of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. The aggregates subject to change as a condition, as object condition,🔽for the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, for the knowledge of the divine ear element, for the knowledge of penetration of minds,

original: paccayo. Vipākadhammadhammā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,🔽yathākammupagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa  yathākammupaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: for the knowledge of recollection of past lives, for the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings, for the knowledge of the future,

original: Vipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— vipākadhammadhamme
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka dhamma dhamme
translated: The aggregates subject to change as a condition, as object condition, for the aggregates subject to change …

original: khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti; taṁ ārabbha
analyzed: khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti tam ārabbha
translated: When they reflect on the aggregates subject to change as being impermanent, painful, and not-self, and they enjoy it, and find satisfaction and delight in it,

original: rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati, kusalākusale niruddhe vipāko tadārammaṇatā🔽uppajjati. Ākāsānañcāyatanakusalaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanavipākassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ākiñcaññāyatanakusalaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanavipākassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati kusala akusale niruddhe vipāko tad ārammaṇa tā  uppajjati ākāsānañcāyatana kusalam viññāṇañcāyatana vipākassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  ākiñcaññāyatana kusalam nevasaññānāsaññāyatana vipākassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: When lust arises … When grief arises … When a wholesome or an unwholesome consciousness has ceased, the result that has that as its object arises.🔽A wholesome consciousness of the base of infinite space is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant consciousness of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—arahā🔽maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati. Arahā pahīne🔽kilese paccavekkhati, pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānāti, vipākadhammadhamme khandhe🔽aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati, cetopariyañāṇena vipākadhammadhammacittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo arahā  maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṃ paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati arahā pahīne  kilese paccavekkhati pubbe samudāciṇṇe kilese jānāti vipāka dhamma dhamme khandhe  aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena vipāka dhamma dhamma citta samaṅgissa
translated: A wholesome consciousness of the base of nothingness is a condition, as object condition, for a resultant consciousness of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: cittaṁ jānāti. Ākāsānañcāyatanakusalaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanakiriyassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: cittam jānāti ākāsānañcāyatana kusalam viññāṇañcāyatana kiriyassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is an outcome of kamma and is also a resultant is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is neither an outcome of kamma nor a resultant—When a perfected being, after emerging from a path attainment, reviews the path, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the fruit of stream-entry, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or the fruit of arahantship, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the way, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the way and the knowledge and vision of the fruit, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the way and the knowledge and vision of the path, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the fruit and the knowledge and vision of the path, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the fruit and the knowledge and vision of the fruit, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the path and the knowledge and vision of the fruit, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the path, the knowledge and vision of the fruit, and the knowledge and vision of the way, he is a condition, as object condition, for the path. When he reviews the knowledge and vision of the path, the knowledge and vision of the fruit, and the knowledge and vision of the path, he is a condition, as object

original: paccayo. Ākiñcaññāyatanakusalaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakiriyassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Vipākadhammadhammā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: paccayaḥ ākiñcaññāyatana kusalam nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kiriyassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammā khandhā cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: wholesome consciousness of the base of nothingness is a condition, as object condition, for the functional consciousness of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.🔽Resultant and functional phenomena are a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of penetration of minds, for knowledge of past lives,

original: yathākammupagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: yathākammupaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: for knowledge of faring on in accordance with kamma, for knowledge of the future, and for adverting.🔽A functional phenomenon that is neither resultant nor causally induced is a condition, as object condition,

original: paccayo—arahā nibbānaṁ paccavekkhati. Nibbānaṁ āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Arahā cakkhuṁ aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati. Sotaṁ … ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ🔽… rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … nevavipākanavipākadhammadhamme
analyzed: paccayoarahā nibbānam paccavekkhati nibbānam āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  arahā cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati sotam ghānam jivham kāya  rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamme
translated: for a functional phenomenon that is neither resultant nor causally induced—a perfected being reviews Nibbāna. Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the adverting.🔽A perfected being contemplates as impermanent, as painful, and as not-self, forms cognizable by the eye… sounds cognizable by the ear…odours cognizable by the nose…flavours cognizable by the tongue…tangibles cognizable by the body…mental phenomena cognizable by the mind.🔽He contemplates as impermanent, as painful, and as not-self, the mental phenomena that are neither-resultant-nor-causally-induced.

original: khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati, dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya
analyzed: khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya
translated: He sees forms with the divine eye. He hears sounds with the divine ear.

original: sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammacittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: sota dhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamma citta samaṅgissa
translated: with the ear as a requisite condition …🔽with the mind as a requisite condition, he knows cognizance accompanied by equanimity that is neither affected by resulting-rebirth-linking nor by resultant .

original: cittaṁ jānāti. Ākāsānañcāyatanakiriyaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanakiriyassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Ākiñcaññāyatanakiriyaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakiriyassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: cittam jānāti ākāsānañcāyatana kiriyam viññāṇañcāyatana kiriyassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ ākiñcañña āyatana kiriyam nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kiriyassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: The intimation of the base of infinite space is a condition, as object condition, for the intimation of the base of infinite consciousness.🔽The intimation of the base of nothingness is a condition, as object condition, for the intimation of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: paccayo. Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,
analyzed: paccayaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa
translated: The states that are neither result nor have result as their object are a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of the kinds of supernormal power, for the knowledge of the divine ear element,

original: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— nibbānaṁ
analyzed: pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nibbāna
translated: for the knowledge of recollecting past lives, for the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings, and for adverting.🔽The states that are neither result nor have result as their object are a condition, as object condition, for a resultant state—🔽Nibbana is a condition, as object condition, for the fruition attainment.

original: phalassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Sekkhā vā puthujjanā vā cakkhuṁ aniccato dukkhato
analyzed: phalassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sekkhāḥ vā puthujjanāḥ vā cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ
translated: Those in higher training and ordinary people, with the eye as a requisite condition, … with the ear as a requisite condition, … with the mind as a requisite condition, …

original: anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti; taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ
analyzed: anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassa
translated: contemplate a form as suffering, contemplate it as not self, on that occasion greed arises in dependence on the four mental aggregates.

original: uppajjati. Kusalākusale niruddhe vipāko tadārammaṇatā uppajjati. Sotaṁ … ghānaṁ …
analyzed: uppajjati kusala akusale niruddhe vipākaḥ tad ārammaṇa tā uppajjati sotam ghānam
translated: When the wholesome and unwholesome are finished, the result and the object of the result arise. The ear …

original: jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ … rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … nevavipākanavipākadhammadhamme
analyzed: jivham kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamme
translated: The nose … The tongue … The body … Forms … Sounds … Smells … Tastes … Tactile objects … The physical basis … The thoughts that are neither results nor related to results

original: khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti; taṁ ārabbha🔽rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Kusalākusale niruddhe vipāko tadārammaṇatā
analyzed: khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti tam ārabbha  rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati kusala akusale niruddhe vipāko tad ārammaṇa tā
translated: contemplate as impermanent, as painful, or as not self, they enjoy it, they welcome it, they remain holding to it.

original: uppajjati. Rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—sekkhā
analyzed: uppajjati rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya usekkhā
translated: From that arises lust, … or grief. When the wholesome and unwholesome are finished, the result and the object of the result arise. The form sense-sphere is a condition, as object condition, for eye-consciousness. The sound sense-sphere … The smell sense-sphere … The taste sense-sphere … The tangible sense-sphere is a condition, as object condition, for body-consciousness.🔽A state that is neither result nor related to a result is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is a result and related to a result. The trainees

original: nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti; nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: contemplate Nibbāna. Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the change-of-lineage consciousness, for the path, and for fruition.

original: paccayo. Sekkhā vā puthujjanā vā cakkhuṁ aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti
analyzed: paccayaḥ sekkhāḥ vā puthujjanāḥ vā cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti
translated: Learners and ordinary people contemplate the eye as impermanent, as suffering, as nonself; they relish it,🔽they are greedy for it, they are pleased with it. From that delight in the eye, greed arises, … sorrow arises. They contemplate the ear … the mind as impermanent, as suffering, as nonself; they relish it,

original: abhinandanti; taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Sotaṁ …pe… nevavipākanavipākadhammadhamme
analyzed: abhinandanti tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati sotam pe na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamme
translated: they are greedy for it, they are pleased with it. From that delight in the mind, greed arises, … sorrow arises. They contemplate thoughts that are neither results nor related to results as impermanent, as suffering, as nonself; they relish it,

original: khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassanti, assādenti abhinandanti …pe… dibbena🔽cakkhunā rūpaṁ passanti, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇanti, cetopariyañāṇena nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammacittasamaṅgissa🔽cittaṁ jānanti. Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,
analyzed: khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassanti assādenti abhinandanti pe dibbena  cakkhunā rūpam passanti dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇanti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamma citta samaṅgissa  cittam jānanti na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa
translated: they are greedy for it, they are pleased with it. From that delight in thoughts that are neither results nor related to results, greed arises, … sorrow arises. They contemplate the five aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as nonself; they relish it,

original: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: they are greedy for it, they are pleased with it. From that delight in the five aggregates, greed arises, … sorrow arises. They see a form with the divine eye, they hear a sound with the divine ear element, they know the mind of someone else with the knowledge of the mind of another. The five aggregates that are neither results nor related to results are a condition, as object condition, for the knowledge of the mind of another, for the knowledge of past lives, for the knowledge of death and rebirth, and for the knowledge of the ending of defilements.

analyzed: paccayaḥ cakkhum garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: Taking the eye as a basis, he delights in it and finds pleasure in it. Delight and pleasure give rise to craving.

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sotaṁ …pe… nevavipākanavipākadhammadhamme khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati sotam pe na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhamme khandhe garum katvā assādeti
translated: Craving gives rise to views. Taking the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … the mind as a basis, he delights in it and finds pleasure in it.

original: abhinandati; taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: Delight and pleasure give rise to craving. Craving gives rise to views.

original: Anantara🔽Vipāko dhammo vipākassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā vipākā🔽khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo. Pañcaviññāṇaṁ
analyzed: anantara  vipākaḥ dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā vipākā  khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam vipākānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ pañca viññāṇa
translated: Immediately preceding condition

original: vipākamanodhātuyā anantarapaccayena paccayo. Vipākamanodhātu vipākamanoviññāṇadhātuyā🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vipāka manas dhātuyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka manas dhātu vipāka manas viññāṇa dhātuyāḥ  anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A resultant idea is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for a resultant idea. The earlier … khandhas are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the later … khandhas. The five resultants are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the resultant mind element. The resultant mind element is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the resultant mind-consciousness element.

original: Vipāko dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. Bhavaṅgaṁ
analyzed: vipākaḥ dhammaḥ na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ bhavaṅga
translated: A resultant idea is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for a non-resultant idea. The life-continuum is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the life-continuum.

original: āvajjanāya anantarapaccayena paccayo. Vipākamanoviññāṇadhātu kiriyamanoviññāṇadhātuyā
analyzed: āvajjanāya anantara paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka manas viññāṇa dhātu kiriya manas viññāṇa dhātuyā
translated: The preceding adverting consciousness is a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding adverting consciousness. The resultant mind element is a condition, as proximate condition, for the functional mind element.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The resultant mind element is a condition, as proximity condition, for the functional mind element.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā🔽vipākadhammadhammā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ vipākadhammadhammānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā  vipāka dhamma dhammā khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam vipāka dhamma dhammānam khandhānam
translated: A resultant idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a resultant idea—the preceding resultant ideas are a condition, as proximity condition, for the succeeding resultant ideas.🔽The prior wholesome and functional ideas are a condition, as proximity condition, for the subsequent wholesome and functional ideas.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo. Anulomaṁ gotrabhussa … anulomaṁ vodānassa … gotrabhu maggassa
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa anulomam vodānassa gotrabhu maggassa
translated: The conformity is a condition, as proximity condition, for the change-of-lineage. The conformity is a condition, as proximity condition, for the cleansing. The change-of-lineage is a condition, as proximity condition, for the path.

original: … vodānaṁ maggassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Vipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo— vipākadhammadhammā🔽khandhā vuṭṭhānassa … maggo phalassa … sekkhānaṁ anulomaṁ phalasamāpattiyā … nirodhā
analyzed: vodānam maggassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammā  khandhāḥ vuṭṭhānassa maggo phalassa sekkhānam anulomam phala samāpattiyāḥ nirodhā
translated: The cleansing is a condition, as proximity condition, for the path.🔽A resultant idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a resultant idea—the resultant ideas are a condition, as proximity condition, for the emergence. The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the fruition. The conformity of the trainers is a condition, as proximity condition, for the fruition attainment. The emergence from cessation is a condition, as proximity condition, for the wholesome of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. The fruition attainment is a condition, as proximity condition, for the emergence.

original: vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakusalaṁ phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kusalam phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: The wholesome of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is a condition, as proximity condition, for the fruition attainment.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo—purimā purimā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ🔽nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo— āvajjanā
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa anantara paccayena  paccayopurimā purimāḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ pacchimānam  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā
translated: A non-resultant-by-nature and a resultant-by-nature idea is an immediately preceding condition for a non-resultant-by-nature and a resultant-by-nature idea.🔽The prior prior aggregates are an immediately preceding condition for the later later aggregates.🔽A non-resultant-by-nature and a resultant-by-nature idea is an immediately preceding condition for a resultant idea.

original: pañcannaṁ viññāṇānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo. Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammā khandhā🔽vuṭṭhānassa, arahato anulomaṁ phalasamāpattiyā … nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakiriyaṁ
analyzed: pañcannam viññāṇānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammāḥ khandhāḥ  vuṭṭhānassa arahataḥ anulomam phala samāpattiyāḥ nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatana kiriya
translated: Attention is an immediately preceding condition for the five kinds of consciousness. The aggregates that are non-resultant-by-nature and resultant-by-nature are an immediately preceding condition for the emergence from the attainment.

original: phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The profitable and functional ideas belonging to the arahat’s emergence from conformity are an immediately preceding condition for the fruition attainment. … The fruition attainment belonging to the emergence from the attainment of cessation is an immediately preceding condition for the fruition attainment.🔽The profitable and functional ideas belonging to the emergence from the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception are an immediately preceding condition for the fruition attainment.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—āvajjanā vipākadhammadhammānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā vipāka dhamma dhammānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-resultant and a resultant-by-recepti on state is an immediately preceding condition for a resultant-by-recepti on state. The adverting is an immediately preceding condition for the resultant-by-recepti on aggregates.

original: Samanantara
analyzed: samanantara
translated: Simultaneous

original: Vipāko dhammo vipākassa dhammassa samanantarapaccayena paccayo. (Anantarasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: vipākaḥ dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ anantara sadisa
translated: A resultant state is a simultaneous condition for a resultant state. (As for the rest, they are similar to the immediately preceding condition.)

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo— paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu vipākānam khandhānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-resultant and neither-result-nor-resultant-by-nature state is a condition, as conascence condition, for a resultant state. At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is a condition, as conascence condition, for the resultant aggregates.

original: Vipāko ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo ca dhammā vipākassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipāko eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe….🔽Vipāko ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo ca dhammā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa
analyzed: vipāko ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo ca dhammāḥ vipākassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccaya upaṭisandhi khaṇe vipāko ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam pe vipākaḥ ca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo ca dhammāḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa
translated: A resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state are a condition, as conascence condition, for a resultant state. At the moment of rebirth-linking, one resultant aggregate and the physical basis are a condition, as conascence condition, for the three aggregates …

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo—vipākā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ vipākā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: A resultant and a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state are a condition, as conascence condition, for a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-nature state. The resultant aggregates and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe paṭisandhi khaṇe vipākā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca kaṭattā rūpānam sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … At the moment of rebirth-linking, the resultant aggregates and the great primaries are a condition, as conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo ca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo ca dhammā nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa

original: Pakatūpanissayo—kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ samādiyati …pe… saṅghaṁ
analyzed: pakata upanissaya ukāyikam sukham upanissāya dānam deti sīlam samādiyati pe saṅgha
translated: A natural supporting condition: One gives a gift, takes up a virtuous way of life, etc., depending on bodily pleasure. One gives a gift, takes up a virtuous way of life, etc., depending on bodily pain.

original: bhindati. Kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ samādiyati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati.🔽Kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ saddhāya …pe… patthanāya upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bhindati kāyikam dukkham upanissāya dānam deti sīlam samādiyati pe saṅgham bhindati  kāyikam sukham kāyikam dukkham saddhāya pe patthanāya upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Bodily pleasure and bodily pain are a condition, as a natural state condition, for faith, etc., and for the kinds of direct knowledge and for the fruits .

original: Vipāko dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….
analyzed: vipākaḥ dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe
translated: A resultant is a condition, as a natural state condition, for a non-resultant and resultant-non-resultant idea.

original: Pakatūpanissayo—arahā kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ upanissāya anuppannaṁ kiriyasamāpattiṁ uppādeti,🔽uppannaṁ samāpajjati, saṅkhāre aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati, kāyikaṁ dukkhaṁ
analyzed: pakata upanissaya uarahā kāyikam sukham upanissāya anuppannam kiriya samāpattim uppādeti  uppannam samāpajjati saṅkhāre aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati kāyikam dukkha
translated: A natural state condition: A perfected being, depending on bodily pleasure, generates a non-percipient attainment that has not already arisen.🔽He attains the cessation of perception and feeling that has not already arisen. He comprehends formations as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, a tumour, a dart, a calamity, an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a plague, a disaster, a terror, a menace, as fickle, perishable, unenduring, as no protection, no shelter, no refuge, as empty, vain, not-self. He comprehends feeling as though pursued by a danger, as a disaster, as a disease, a tumour, a dart, a calamity, an affliction.

original: upanissāya anuppannaṁ kiriyasamāpattiṁ uppādeti, uppannaṁ samāpajjati …pe….
analyzed: upanissāya anuppannam kiriya samāpattim uppādeti uppannam samāpajjati pe
translated: He generates a non-percipient attainment that has not already arisen. He attains the cessation of perception and feeling that has not already arisen.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….🔽Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… mānaṁ jappeti … diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti.🔽Sīlaṁ … sutaṁ … cāgaṁ … paññaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti. Rāgaṁ🔽… dosaṁ … mohaṁ … mānaṁ … diṭṭhiṁ … patthanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ🔽uppādeti, pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati …pe… saddhā …pe… patthanā saddhāya …

original: Vipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….🔽Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya attānaṁ ātāpeti paritāpeti, pariyiṭṭhimūlakaṁ

translated: A resultant phenomenon is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a resultant phenomenon.🔽The decisive support condition is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the suffering of self-mortification based on the view of self-mortification.

original: dukkhaṁ paccanubhoti …pe… patthanaṁ upanissāya attānaṁ ātāpeti paritāpeti …pe… saddhā
analyzed: dukkham paccanubhoti pe patthanam upanissāya attānam ātāpeti paritāpeti pe saddhā

analyzed: pe patthanā kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa phala samāpattiyā upanissaya paccayena
translated: … Determination is a condition, as decisive support condition, for bodily pleasure, bodily pain, and attainment of the result of stream-entry.🔽Skillful and unskillful action is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the result.

original: paccayo. Kusalākusalaṁ kammaṁ vipākassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Maggo phalasamāpattiyā🔽upanissayapaccayena paccayo.

translated: The path is a condition, as decisive support condition, for attainment of the result.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….🔽Pakatūpanissayo—arahā maggaṁ upanissāya anuppannaṁ kiriyasamāpattiṁ uppādeti, uppannaṁ🔽samāpajjati, saṅkhāre aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati. analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo pakata upanissayo pe  maggam upanissāya anuppannam kiriya samāpattim uppādeti uppanna  samāpajjati saṅkhāre aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati maggaḥ arahataḥ attha paṭisambhidāya  pe ṭhānāṭhānakosallassa upanissaya paccayena paccayo  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe
translated: A state that is an outcome of kamma and a state that is neither kamma nor a kamma-result are related as object-predominance and natural-decisive-support conditions.

original: Pakatūpanissayo—arahā utuṁ … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ upanissāya anuppannaṁ kiriyasamāpattiṁ uppādeti …pe….
analyzed: pakata upanissaya uarahā utum bhojanam senāsanam upanissāya anuppannam kiriya samāpattim uppādeti pe
translated: Natural-decisive-support condition means: a perfected being, by depending on the path, produces a non-percepted attainment that has not arisen, and he enters upon it when it has arisen. He contemplates as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, a tumour, a dart, a calamity, an affliction, foreign, disintegrating, as void, as not self, the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, formations, and the kinds of becoming. The path is related to a perfected being as natural-decisive-support condition for the discrimination of meaning, … for skill in the aggregates, … for skill in the elements, … for skill in the sense bases, … for skill in the truths, … for skill in the dependent origination, … for skill in what is possible and what is impossible, … for the fruit of stream-entry, … for the fruit of once-return, … for the fruit of non-return, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of conventual life, … for the fruit of arahantship, … for the discriminations, … for the analytical knowledges, … for the fruit of convent

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipākassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe
translated: A non-resultant-by-re-linking and a non-result-producing idea is a condition, as decisive-support condition, for a resultant idea, as object-decisive-support, as proximate-decisive-support, as natural-decisive-support.

original: Pakatūpanissayo—utu … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ, kāyikassa sukhassa, kāyikassa dukkhassa, phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.

translated: Natural-decisive-support: the season is a condition, as decisive-support condition, for bodily pleasure, bodily pain, and for fruition attainment.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe….🔽Pakatūpanissayo—utuṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati. analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe  pakata upanissaya uutum upanissāya dānam deti pe saṅgham bhindati bhojanam senāsana  upanissāya dānam deti pe saṅgham bhindati utu bhojanam senāsanam saddhāya

original: …pe… vatthu vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe vatthu vipākānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: When that has ceased, the resultant mind element and mind-consciousness element arise with that as their object. The ear … The nose … The tongue … The body … The visible-data base … The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness … for ear-consciousness … for nose-consciousness … for tongue-consciousness … for body-consciousness … for the kinds of resultant consciousness accompanied by joy … for the kinds of result-ant mind element … for the kinds of resultant mind-consciousness element. The physical basis is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the kinds of resultant consciousness accompanied by joy … for the kinds of resultant mind element … for the kinds of resultant mind-consciousness element.

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo vipākadhammadhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ.🔽Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—sekkhā vā puthujjanā vā cakkhuṁ …pe… ārabbha rāgo …pe… domanassaṁ🔽uppajjati. Sotaṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ …pe… dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejāta  ārammaṇa purejāta sekkhā vā puthujjanā vā cakkhum pe ārabbha rāgaḥ pe domanassa  uppajjati sotam pe vatthum aniccataḥ pe domanassam pe dibbena cakkhunā rūpa
translated: A non-resultant-and-non-result-constituent state is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a resultant-constituent state, as object-prenascence and as physical-basis-prenascence.🔽As object-prenascence: When a trainer or an ordinary man sees a visible object with the eye, there arises in him greed or resentment or a corresponding perception or a corresponding thought. When he hears a sound with the ear … smells an odour with the nose … tastes a flavour with the tongue … touches a tangible with the body … When he knows a mental object with the mind, there arises in him greed or resentment or a corresponding perception or a corresponding thought.

original: …pe… dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ …pe….
analyzed: pe dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam pe
translated: As physical-basis-prenascence: When one who has attained a resultant concentration or a resultant supernormal power sees a visible object with the divine eye … hears a sound with the divine ear …

original: Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu vipākadhammadhammānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vatthu purejāta vatthu vipāka dhamma dhammānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The prenascent materiality is a condition, as prenascent condition, for the resultant mentality-materiality.

translated: Postnascent
